instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00165: What is 820-00165? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.U1950: What is U1950? This chip often becomes corroded on pin 8 on the PP3V42_G3H pin causing PM_SLP_S4_L to go missing.
definitions.ALL_SYS_PWRGD: What is ALL_SYS_PWRGD? ALL_SYS_PWRGD is present when PP1V8_S3, PP5V_S3, PP1V2_S3, PP1V05_S0, PP5V_S0, PP3V3_S0, & PP1V5_S0 are present and working. If any of these rails is not working, ALL_SYS_PWRGD will be pulled down and the machine will not turn on. .
definitions.U7501: What is U7501? This chip is often responsible for creating PP3V3_S5,  PP3V3_S3,  PP3V3_S0,  PP5V_S5,  PP5V_S4,  PP5V_S0.
definitions.PP5V_S4RS3: What is PP5V_S4RS3? PP5V_S4RS3 is a 5v power rail present when the machine is in an S4 suspend to disk state..

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> S0 state no cpu vcore
threads.message:
Board looks clean no water damage at all, but it looks like the computer was dropped from a high distance.

Sometimes the fan spins and looks like the computer is on, but no cpu vcore at all even while there is fan spin, most of the time it stays in S0 state but wont turn on at all.

Starts up everytime in SMC bypass but no vcore either.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> S0 state no cpu vcore
threads.message:
Dropped machines are nightmare, I don't recommend to waste much time on it.
Check if pins 7 & 3 of <CHIP>U1950</CHIP> stay high.
Possibly broken traces/solders underneath CPU...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> S0 state no cpu vcore
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> S0 state no cpu vcore
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> S0 state no cpu vcore
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> S0 state no cpu vcore
threads.message:
Post all secondary voltages; big coils from the MLB.
You cannot get VCORE, without <SIGNAL>ALL_SYS_PWRGD</SIGNAL>.
One secondary power supply pulls it down...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> S0 state no cpu vcore
threads.message: Now the board is not entering S0 state anymore. so I started troubleshooting all power rails and <SIGNAL>PP5V_S4RS3</SIGNAL> was missing, I gave <CHIP>U7501</CHIP> new solder joins and walla! board now turns on and works as expected.
